result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian D Dietz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

No contact with: victim listed in the criminal complaint. 
  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Maintain full time employment and/or school combination.
  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non-working hours.
To be performed as a condition of probation.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on November 30, 2017 at 11:00 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brian D Dietz in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  Attorney Hoff requests the court schedule the case for sentencing in a few weeks to allow for payment of upfront restitution.   The court schedules accordingly.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 14, 2017 at 08:15 am.
Jury status hearing on November 9, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Brian D Dietz in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Hoff requests one additional further proceeding to allow his defendant to have an AODA assessment.  The Court schedules the case for trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 9, 2017 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 14, 2017 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on September 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian D Dietz in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.   Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.      The Attorney advises the Court he has received discovery and an offer.  The Attorney to advise the Court how the case will proceed at the next hearing.  The Defendant is instruct to report to the business office to set up a payment plan for his court appointed attorney.  Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
Defendant to pay: $50 per month commencing 9/1/17
Hearing on August 7, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian D Dietz in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant does not have an attorney. State presented offer. Court addressed defendant with retaining counsel.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation and come back this morning. 
Court grants petition to appoint counsel. Defendant to pay $50.00 per month, commencing September 1, 2017.

Case recalled at 10:13 a.m. Same appearances.
Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defendant submitted petition for appointment of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for August 7, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on July 10, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Brian D Dietz in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court will quash the warrant.  Court notes that the defendant refused to be evaluated by WCS prior to court today.  Defendant provides what he believes to be his current address but is not sure of the exact address as he just moved.  Defendant provided with infomation regarding the public defender's office.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
